ProviderLocation: 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-2413 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-2413
ReviewText: We just arrived in LA and decided to go there for dinner. The service is outstanding and the best part of going. The food came fast and hot. The servers were very nice and very accommodating. The restaurant was a bit loud for our taste but could be because it was very crowded. The food was average but there was plenty of it. When I say average it was because there wasn't a lot of spices which I like a lot. Overall we would go back again.

ProviderLocation: 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-2413 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-2413
ReviewText: Love this place! Warm greetings from staff when you arrive. Servers in Guayaberas shirts. Fun decor: oil paintings of Mayan warriors, portraits of Benito Juarez, a fishtanks, two bars, Mexican folk art. Full menu of delicious traditional food. Fresh tortillas made next to the bar. AMAZING PRICES. Happy Hour Margaritas $4!!!! Unheard of in this area. Meat eaters love the Carnitas. Vegetarian: get the Zucchini and Mushroom tacos. But it's all good. Delish!

ProviderLocation: 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-2413 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-2413
ReviewText: It's kitchy, it's tiny, it's a bit greasy - it is FANTASTIC! If you want fancy-schmancy this is not for you. Nor will you get white glove service, so suck it up. What you will get is authentic yummy, cheesy enchiladas, and fish tacos that melt in your mouth. Margaritas are great, and even the house wine is not bad. If you want good ol'fashioned Mexican for a great price - this is your spot.
ReviewTitle: One of my all-time fave Mexican spots

ProviderLocation: 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-2413 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-2413
ReviewText: I'm a little ashamed to say that after living in Westchester for over 30 years, I'm only now discovering this place. Perhaps it's the fact that it's been overshadowed by Paco's, down the road and also at one time, down the block. Hacienda Del Rey serves the kind of Mexican I've had a preference for—simple and genuine. The refried beans are the slightly creamy variety (in comparison to the stiffer, stand-up-to-the-spoon variety) and the rice is the loose, yellowish variety. I had a ground beef enchilada and tamale, both simply enjoyable. The margaritas are another picture of "simply enjoyable". The modest size of the establishment makes for a more personal experience. This isn't where you look for fancy meals and frills; just good food.
ReviewTitle: Great Little Spot for Mexican Food

ProviderLocation: 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-2413 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-2413
ReviewText: My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch on our way to LAX. It's a little hole in the wall place with dated decor, but don't let that stop you! The staff was quick and friendly, the food was great, the skinny Cazadores Cadillac Margaritas are second to none, plus they had several TVs with the football games on. Perfecto!

ProviderLocation: 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90045-2413 8347 Lincoln Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90045-2413
ReviewText: Remodel is an improvement to a good value and close to airport.!the rooms are ok but the restaurant is the best. Transport ant to airport is in frequent needs improving

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: The Japanese Village Plaza Mall in L.A.'s Little Tokyo teeters between exotic and kitsch, but it makes an amusing diversion every so often. I have always found the Japanese food served at Oomasa to be of high quality. Sushi, sashimi, tempura--the fare I enjoy at a Japanese restaurant--are all done well here. The sashimi is delicate and easily melts on the tongue. I have had more deftly made tempura, but what is served here is better than average. I have always found the service to be attentive, even when the restaurant is busy. This is a popular place among both Asian and Anglo patrons.
ReviewTitle: First-class Japanese Food in Modest Surroundings

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: We went to Oomasa for dinner and were pleasantly surprised. They offer nice combinations in their "dinner specials" such as a mix of sashimi, chicken teriyaki and sushi, so you can get to try various things. It all was quite tasty. The portions are rather large.

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: Highly recommend! Very high quality food and can be very busy in weekends! Weekdays are easy to get a table!

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: picked this place on the recommendations of reviews, and it didn't disappoint for Lunch. The bento is very good value and the service was quick and efficient. Very authentic food and decor. No waiting for us we must have got lucky. It is better than a score of 4, but not a 5.

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: There are several earteries in Japanese Village Mall in Little Tokyo, but we consider this is the best for an authentic Japanese meal. It's not classic food you might find at an upcscale eatery in Japan. It's food you would expect to find in a native run restuarant serving both the general pubic and Japanese alike. There was a full sushi bar and table service with "mature" mama-sans as.servers. They had bento box dinners as will as meals you can assemble from the varied menu. Everything we had from tempura dishes to sushi were delicious. Prices were moderates, too!

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: This is an excellent example of a traditional JAPANESE sushi bar! Phenomenal toro and everything else is top notch! If you're looking for Korean rolls and miscellaneous junk this is not for you. Always a wait to get in but worth the effort.

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: I returned to this restaurant after one year and was surprised how it decay, as well all the japanese village (many open places for rent). This time I ordered a combination lunch of pork cutlet and shashimi. The pork was very hard, the fish didn't seem so fresh, the pickles smelled bad. It was a wednesday lunch, a busy weekday, so the food should be fresh. I think next time I will try another place.

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: I must of gotten lucky after reading the other reviews. I was able to get a seat at the bar right away. I started with a chriashi bowl. the chef delivered a beautiful assortment of fish in basically a bento box style tray, not to much rice, which was nice. Every bit of the sushi was excellent. I only had one other item, a handroll with Natto, it was the first time I had ever had it that way, and I must say i thought it was a cool way of serving it. I would go back for sure.
ReviewTitle: nice little spot in Little Tokyo

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: I have been going there ever since I was student... I have never lived in LA but just about every visit to LA, I go back to that place...for more than 30 years and more than 100 times. It is real.

ProviderLocation: 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles , CA 90012-3909 100 Alameda street , 100 Japanese Village Plaza Mall , Los Angeles, CA 90012-3909
ReviewText: When I'm in LA and in the mood for sushi, I really like this place. They may not have the absolute highest quality sushi, but it is pretty good, and I really like their dinner specials. In particular, I go for the sashimi/sushi/chicken teryaki/salad combo, or sometimes the same combo but with tempura in place of sashimi. It's a lot of food (it comes with miso soup and green tea ice cream too; there's also a very random macaroni salad that doesn't really fit in at a Japanese restaurant), but the variety is great, quality is generally good, and I enjoy it.

ProviderLocation: 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 90005-3112 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 90005-3112
ReviewText: The salad bar is an excellent choice, but not that pleased with the individual choices on the menu. I didn't think the staff was as friendly as I'd like at a restaurant.

ProviderLocation: 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 90005-3112 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 90005-3112
ReviewText: Definitely better choices nearby. Salad bar is reasonable, but don't try the steak. Wouldn't go again.

ProviderLocation: 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 90005-3112 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 90005-3112
ReviewText: Food tasted ok but i must of got food poisioning as i was very ill all the next day and took about three days to fully recover.I willl never ever step foot in another sizzler as long as i live
ReviewTitle: nice food but you pay for it the next day

ProviderLocation: 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 90005-3112 710 South Western Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 90005-3112
ReviewText: I remember being a kid and sizzler being a fun, clean, good place to eat. Their onion rings, salads, and chicken wings were good. Also, their self serve ice cream was great. Today, the restuarants are always dirty. They have horible employees that do not care. Their chefs are terrible. The food is nasty and the overall environment totally sucks. I will never eat at sizzler ever...their ribs are horrible and they seem to be running like a fast food joint rather than a restuarant.
ReviewTitle: I don't know how this restuarant still exists

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: Perfect hotel for touring Universal Studios or Warner Bros Studios. We stayed Wed & Thur night with a great Groupon rate. The hotel grounds are beautiful. The Front Yard restaurant is in the front yard. Beautiful trees and bushes surround the hotel premises. The hotel has been updated and looks sharp. Only hotel drawback was one of the elevators in the building we were in was down for upgrading and with only two people working the front desk, I waited for 15 minutes to check out. After waiting that long with the same people at the desk, I left and phoned them to email me my receipt. Other than those two instances, we loved the hotel and would return. Kinda close to the 101 Fwy so we did hear road noise from our room on the East side of the hotel. Oh, and they charged $22 for parking or $27 for valet per day. I guess you gotta pay in LA.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: We weren't sure about the location in Hollywood before we arrived, but quickly realised it was perfect for our LA stay. The location felt safe, and was close to Universal, Warner bros tour, Griffith Observatory and with a free shuttle bus to Universal and also the metro where it was only one metro stop to the Chinese theatre and stars. The hotel is clean and very pretty at night with the lights, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant also serves good food and amazing cocktails.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: We chose the Garland because we were going to Bel Air for jazz one evening, and DTLA for dinner the next evening and it was a central location, especially because we took "Lyft". During the day we walked to Ventura Boulevard, which, offers so much! We were pleasantly surprised that we loved this hotel....we weren't expecting it to be like a boutique hotel....it felt that way. The attention to decorating detail is what I noticed immediately in our room and the restaurant....just look around and you find something interesting to see. Our room 408 was quiet, and away from the elevator, which is what I requested. I loved the bathroom; it was Feng Shui with it's simplicity, no shower curtain, but a great half non-moving glass "door", really clean. We liked and used the very quiet refrigerator in the room. We will stay again.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: Tiny bathroom with the smallest bathroom counter I can remember, tiny closet, designer paint scheme in 1950's orange, and a tiny balcony overlooking a freeway! This place is more like a Hollywood set than a good hotel: all front with the minimum possible in real comfort. And what should have been a lobby entrance was shared with a busy restaurant.
ReviewTitle: Short changes the basics for glitz.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: Being our 7th visit again very impressed, all staff and managers are very friendly, helpful and professional. On arrival you will receive a welcoming greeting. The rooms are spotlessly clean, beds very comfortable. The hotel itself has many amenities including a swimming pool and an excellent Jacuzzi. The Garland is ideally situated on a bus route . It also offers free transportation to Universal studios (very close) the shuttle also stops at the metro station where you can catch the subway direct to the walk of fame and many other places. Will certainly be returning next year.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: The Garland is a wonderful hotel with an Amazing staff,from the front desk to the bell men , valet to the pleasant housekeeping staff! Also The Yard restaurant staff is terrific, the food there is also great and the service is even better my favorite server is Sonia she always has a smile on her face and remembers everyone's name! The Garland makes you feel like you are at home while being away!

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: The room location was in the back of the property with a view of the skylights across the freeway looking at Universal Studios Theme Park. It felt like I had the floor (Third Level) to myself. I wouldn't mind returning to stay again. The reason for the stay was that I attended the USC Vrs Cal game in football and the game ended about 10PM. Home is about a good two hours driving so I opted to stay the night. Picking that Hotel was not my first choice, but it was by dumb luck that I chose it.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: I have stayed here for years and it keeps getting better. The service is wonderful and the restaurant menu is varied and delicious. I see families playing in the pool all day long. The hotel rooms are quiet and clean. The only complaint I have is that I miss the magnified bathroom mirror which seems to have been taken down, at least in the last two rooms I stayed in. It's great for singles or families and extremely convenient to Universal (they offer a free bus there).

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: i spent a week at the Garland at the end of October and had a wonderful time. The staff was accommodating (I was upgraded to a suite), and the hotel was attractive and comfortable. There were many families staying there, and the Garland has activities and facilities for children.

ProviderLocation: 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles , CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn) 4222 Vineland Avenue , Los Angeles, CA 91602-3318 (Formerly Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn)
ReviewText: I poured over reviews to find the perfect hotel to stay at in the Los Angeles area during my recent trip to California. I spent a couple days in Anaheim and then went to Los Angeles for a few days to visit a friend and check some attractions off of my travel to-do list. The Garland was a perfect location, close to attractions such as Universal Studios and Warner Bros. Studios. The hotel has trolley service to Universal and to the metro station as well. Staff were fantastic and extremely helpful, pleasant from the time I checked in! They were also great and had spot-on suggestions on modes of travel and knew the area well. I also loved the grounds, pool area and room was perfect. It was extremely clean and quiet. I enjoyed breakfast one day at the restaurant on premises and again, staff were friendly. The order came quickly and they have both indoor and outdoor seating (in a very lovely area). Since I had things planned for the time I was there I was not able to partake in the planned events The Garland offers - but the schedule was great and they have activities such as movies at the pool, yoga, walks and game nights. I will definitely stay here again when I travel to the area!
ReviewTitle: First stay here - will DEFINITELY return!

ProviderLocation: 400 S Hope St , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2801 400 S Hope St , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2801
ReviewText: Christmas day, table booked. empty restaurant.... After being seated - waited thirty minutes for a drink to be offered and served. Waited a further fifteen before we approached the staff. Lovely waitress was hugely apologetic. When we asked for the GM, only the DM was available. He was obviously incredibly embarrassed - even as though this was standard procedure. Seems others on this site have experienced similar 'service' Don't let this establishment mar any event you may be planning. Our first Christmas together for five years... ruined by McCormick & Schmicks LAX. P.S. The reason we chose this restaurant was because five years ago we had the most perfect Christmas in the restaurant in SFO... PLEASE go there!!!!!!!

ProviderLocation: 1341 N Wilmington Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90744-2453 1341 N Wilmington Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90744-2453
ReviewText: If you haven't been here your missing out. Best mexican food in town. The mojado burritos are spectacular!

ProviderLocation: 1341 N Wilmington Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90744-2453 1341 N Wilmington Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90744-2453
ReviewText: Authentic Mexican food at very reasonable prices. Free chips and salsa. Excellent mojado (wet) burritos. If you like spicy, this is the place.

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: best Indian veg food in town. We happened to try their lunch buffet which was amazing. lot of variety in veggie options and in desserts too. Prompt service,nice helpful and friendly staff and totally good quality of food being served. Not to be missed.

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: I've never been disappointed when visiting Tandoor A India - not with the food anyways. The dining areas are "quaint." The restaurant is located in what appears to be an old house of some kind. As long as it's not too busy, you will likely find the environment very friendly. Highly recommended!
ReviewTitle: One of my favorite Indian restaurants

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: I loved everything about this place. The restaurant is built on a hillside with a very steep driveway up to a small parking lot. (Lots of parking on the street) Split into two separate dining areas with the kitchen in between, the inside was just adorable! We ate upstairs. The wait staff doesn't work specific tables, but all work together to provide fast and very friendly service. We were extremely impressed with all the employees. We asked the waiter who came to take our order for suggestions and he didn't skip a beat in telling us what to get. We had Lamb Tikka Masala and Shrimp Vindaloo (Succulent-cooked to perfection !!) with Basmati Rice and Plain Naan, Garlic Naan and Naan Paratha. Just writing this review makes me want to go back and eat there. Its was all very tasty! Highly recommend !

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: This was a disappointment. They served much more food than most Indian restaurants, and the wait staff was friendly, but the vindaloo was too sweet and tomatoey and not very hot. Other spicy dishes were bland. This was Indian food for those who don't know what to order. The place looked shabby.

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: Me and my Globey wife go to this restuarant at least once a month. We drive all the way from the city of San Fernando just to consume such great food. The service is outstanding and the cooks are amazing. We always order the same dishes and we have never experienced any variation. The food is excellent and the taste is always consistent. We always order the Garlic Naan, Lamb Tika Masala, Chicken Biryani, Chicken Saag and fried onion Baji. I will never eat at any other Indian restuarant in my life and will always support this restuarant. Otter and Globey fOREVER

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: I ate here three times while in the area on business. Very small restaurant in Playa del Rey which looks like a converted house. Food was well prepared and authentic. I experienced prompt service (usually around 8 in the evening), but with only one waiter, I can see why some other reviewers have complained about slow service when they are busy. Parking is also a challenge due to their location. I really hope that they move into a larger and more accessible location someday as their food is worth the visit. They do a large volume of pickup and delivery orders so you can call in if you choose. Only five minutes to LAX, if you are overnighting and craving Indian food. I have tried most all of the Indian restaurants from the Marina freeway south to Redondo Beach and this one gets my vote as the best.

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: Within walking distance of our hotel and the food was good. The tandoor shrimp was spicy and delicious. Loved the lentils and naan as well.

ProviderLocation: 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90293-7844 8406 Pershing Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90293-7844
ReviewText: Customer service would do to a restaurant's rating. The food here is absolutely amazing! The owner is such a nice guy. I had a fish dish from here and it was great. I order the Raita my first order, which I believe may have been a bit extra. Tried to be a good customer and call in instead of going through GH so I can pay for any extras...why did they tell me me that the minimum delivery order was something different then what GrubHub had listed on their site? I really really really like this place too. I even gave their menu to some other coworkers. So we all were going to order (7 people total) Just a little bit of advice don't sacrifice a would have been repeat customer for a mere $5. Seriously the food is amazing but the person who answered the phone needs a a brush up on his 'Customer Skills 101.'

ProviderLocation: 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90018-3339 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90018-3339
ReviewText: We went for dinner a couple days after they reopened so the menu was limited but still they had all they're most popular dishes listed. Our waitress, Rachel, was great, we were seated quickly and everything is really clean & open. I had the jumbalaya, which I really liked and my boyfriend had the blue crab gumbo that was also tasty, we had hush puppies for our appetizer h they were great! We were too full for dessert, so next time!

ProviderLocation: 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90018-3339 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90018-3339
ReviewText: the best creole food west of new orleans. the file gumbo was thick, rich and meaty. the crawfish ettoufe was as good as we have ever had. the meatloaf was tender, done perfectly and filling. we had the peach cobbler for dessert, flaky and well done. the service was terrific we will definitely be going back again. it's worth the hour plus drive for us.

ProviderLocation: 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90018-3339 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90018-3339
ReviewText: Harold & Belle's is the place to go if you want some real down home Créole cuisine. This place is being run by the 3rd Generation Legaux Family (Ryan and Jessica). The prices are reasonable. The food is out of this world. And the portions are plenty. There is too much great tasting food on the menu for me to list, so I will just give you the link to their website: http://www.haroldandbellesrestaurant.com/. But if I had to chose, it would be the Gumbo. If you are ever in Los Angeles, please stop by and enjoy some great food and great conversation. You will not be disappointed. 2920 W Jefferson Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90018 (323) 735-9023
ReviewTitle: Want A Real Taste Of Louisiana?

ProviderLocation: 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90018-3339 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90018-3339
ReviewText: My favorite thing here is a red snapper po boy with Cole slaw. Tonight I got the seafood gumbo and let me tell you taste like someones grandma is back there in that kitchen. Crab, chicken, Louisiana sausage, in the dark roux over rice yummm. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu really. And its an LA staple been around for years my mom used to go when she was my age.

ProviderLocation: 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90018-3339 2920 W Jefferson Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90018-3339
ReviewText: Los Angeles' famous Harold and Belle's reopened yesterday just in time for Fat Tuesday. The remodel is outstanding. The bar is much larger and there are plenty of flat TV's. Located in the Jefferson Park community of Los Angeles (Crenshaw/Baldwin Hills) the place is a community jewel. I had the jambalaya and as usual it was outstanding. For those who have an appetite for genuine creole cooking featuring all the usuals you simply will not be disappointed. Even though the place just reopened, expect a crowd or in another word....BE PATIENT. Once you get served and taste the food you will not be disappointed. One more note, Harold and Belle's is a community restaurant. The neighborhood is going through gentrification and like most urban onclaves you have the good and the bad. Don't let the neighborhood make you afraid or timid. Just use common sense and you will be fine.

ProviderLocation: 9161 Reseda Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91324-3031 9161 Reseda Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91324-3031
ReviewText: We go to this Maria's about monthly... the food is generally good (and we really like the flatbreads with olive oil --- when they're served warm). Service is mostly good/efficient, but at times can be pretty poor -- this last time we didn't see our waiter from food delivery until about 10 minutes after our meal.
ReviewTitle: Food good; service genreally ok, too, but just eh this time

ProviderLocation: 9161 Reseda Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91324-3031 9161 Reseda Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91324-3031
ReviewText: One of the few authentic Italian restaurants. Not like one of the chains. Very good with a warm, friendly atmosphere. Parking is great compared to many of the LA restaurants.

ProviderLocation: 445 S Figueroa St , #102 , Los Angeles , CA 90071-1602 445 S Figueroa St , #102 , Los Angeles, CA 90071-1602
ReviewText: We ate here twice, lovely food and HUGE portions! Great value for money. Were given a free cupcake on our second visit which was a lovely touch.

ProviderLocation: 445 S Figueroa St , #102 , Los Angeles , CA 90071-1602 445 S Figueroa St , #102 , Los Angeles, CA 90071-1602
ReviewText: It is fast food Greek and there isn't much or any Greek fare in downtown LA without driving a bit out of the way. However it really had a bland flavor for Greek food and I would probably eat here again but it wouldn't be a destination for Gyros for me.
ReviewTitle: Didn't really love this place, it was just OK

ProviderLocation: 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles , CA 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles, CA
ReviewText: So. We booked in here on Open Table, where my wife is a VIP. We are "A" rated. On arrival, the owner or maitre d' pulls my wife aside and lectures her. "You know , we called you to confirm the reservation and you didn't call us back. You are on time and we are going to honor this reservation, but we doing it as a courtesy. You had better be sure to call us back next time." We shrugged this off as we were held up a few minutes to meet our friends. We proceeded to spend lavishly (and the food is expensive) and buy two $95 bottles of wine and we do commend our server and had a nearly $400 check for four people. On leaving, the maitre d' pulls my wife aside again, presumably to apologize but actually to upbraid her again. "Remember this next time," he repeated. I held myself back from complaining in person at the behest of my wife and our guests. There won't BE a next time.
ReviewTitle: Expensive but good food; bad, visit-ending experience with owner/maitre d'

ProviderLocation: 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles , CA 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles, CA
ReviewText: I made reservations for Valentines through Open Table base on location and menu. Restaurant was small and even though had reservations about a week before we were sitted in their sidewalk area which was covered (with a filthy plastic curtains) and this was suppose to be aromatic dinner? Prices were moderate but was dissapointing with the portions of plates but most importantly it was not the best or close to being the best Italian food that I have had. Restaurant also made a couple of phone calls to make sure that I would keep my reservation, that had never happen to me before.

ProviderLocation: 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles , CA 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles, CA
ReviewText: I've hesitated posting a review, selfishly trying to keep this gem to ourselves. But ...La Cava just celebrated its 6 year anniversary and I figured it's time to share. Having been to Italy multiple times, I can assure you that La Cava is the real deal. Armando, the owner/host is as charming as can be (and quite handsome, my wife assures me!). He also has quite a resume as an actor! The waiters are all top of the line professionals too. But, the star at La Cava ... the food. The menu is full of all your favorites--done better than anywhere else in town and as good as you'll find in any top trattoria in Italy. But the specials showcase La Cava's best. If you haven't tried La Cava... wait no longer. It's the fantastico!

ProviderLocation: 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles , CA 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles, CA
ReviewText: this is a small place, first time went there, the food is super good, they offer a excellent menu, a nice selection of daily specials.. service is great. pricey but good.

ProviderLocation: 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles , CA 13565 Ventura Blvd , Sherman Oaks , Los Angeles, CA
ReviewText: We went here for dinner and were impressed with the feel and the warm atmosphere of the place. Seated at 6:30 PM and the place really picked up about 20 min later. We ordered a grilled veggie salad that we shared and the white fish and pasta special, all at the same time. From here things got strange! While the salad and wine came in a timely manner, our main courses did not. While we were in no rush and really enjoyed sitting on the patio and drinking wine, after a while it was very awkward. Tables seated after us were being served, and one even had finished and left before we got our food. There were no big parties, and we got there early so it was very strange. When our food did finally come out they served it to the wrong table who rejected it and had it sent back. 2 min later they served it to us. The food was served hot, very delicious and nicely presented. But then our table became "invisible" again as we could not get a cup of coffee, or anything for that matter, for at least 20 min after finishing our meal. We finally got out waiter's attention, had coffee and dessert, paid the bill and left. Long and short, I am giving it 4 stars because the food was so good (reason you go out to eat) and the feel and atmosphere was very small/neighborhood, like your a local. The service however was 2 stars. Thought in fairness pretty much everyone else around us had great service.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: Small restaurant with good service and inexpensive food. We had red curry with chicken and noodles with roast duck. The food was pretty good and the portions generous. Good location, near Hollywood...

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: Tried Tom Yam, fried seafood rice, green papaya salad. Huge dishes. Very best. Strongly recommend for all Thai food lovers.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant. My favorite is the boat noodles. Also the holly basil with crispy pork.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: My girlfriend was craving Thai cuisine and we were lucky to find this place which was a short walk from our hotel. I ordered the Doo Dee noodles with short rib while my gf enjoyed the chicken fried rice. Both were authentic in taste and generous in portion. Although I enjoyed my noodles, I didn't feel it was quite good enough for a 4 star ranking in TA. I thought my gf's fried rice was delicious but also wasn't good enough to escape the dreaded 3 star ranking. However, I would return here in the future without hesitation.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: This was suggested to us en route to the hotel by our Lyft driver. He was generally right. The food was relatively cheap and prety good. I didn't fancy my first plate, but SO did, and on our second time I fully enjoyed my plate as well.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: Delicious Thai noodle bowls. Generous portions, the medium level was very spicy. I had noodles with roasted duck, and a Thai iced coffee. Highly recommend both. Friendly and attentive staff.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: A simple, yet great Thai food restaurant. I love eating the Pad Thai and other noodle dishes. I come here pretty often, whenever I want a good meal by my self, or with others.

ProviderLocation: 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90027-5694 5301 W Sunset Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90027-5694
ReviewText: On a recent business trip to L.A. I went to Pa Ord because friends in New York raved about it. When I arrived I was sure I was in the wrong place. It's in a rather run-down strip mall. The atmosphere is like a Chinese take out in New York. But the food is insanely good. The pace was packed when I arrived and I counted that I was one of three non-Thai people there. ReviewText: Restaurant: Terribly slow - 30 minutes' wait before they even asked us about beverages, let alone take our order! So we got up and moved to the bar instead... Bar: Terribly slow service - by this time we were famished so we ordered and waited 40 minutes to eat fries and other finger foods. Nothing to wait for but it was very late and we were desperate. The drinks were worse than what I can mix at home, and I'm a poor mixer. Terribly slow check - can you believe it took them 20 minutes to bring us the check after we asked for it repeatedly. ProviderLocation: 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90024-3033 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90024-3033
ReviewText: Great Service and fun drinks. I was impressed they serve Mezcal margaritas. The food is excellent with a nice relaxed poolside ambience.

ProviderLocation: 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90024-3033 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90024-3033
ReviewText: The restaurant is outdoors next to the pool at the W. It is a wonderful setting in the evening with lights hung in the tree and other light coming from the pool cabanas. For the cooler weather they had erected a clear tent allowing a view of the surrounds while keeping the diners warm. There was no host so we wandered until someone finally helped us to a table. We started with drinks which were good, but $15 for a martini is steep. While our waiter was good he seemed to have little support. We saw little of him and even less of his disheveled assistants. We ordered the prime rib au jus, Medi platter and the cheeseburger. The prime rib was mainly bread with thin juice and sea salt and peppered good crisp French fries. The cheeseburger though requested without came with cheese. One bite and the cook was right in putting the cheese on. It was a delicious sandwich from the meat to the fried pickles. On the side were the best crinkle cut sweet potato fries and coming from someone from the south that says a lot. The Medi platter presentation was beautiful with a selection of olives, tabouli, pita, tapenade, heirloom tomatoes, feta and hummus. All of it was good but none of it was remarkable. If you are looking for a beautiful outdoor setting that is conducive to conversation, laughter, and camaraderie , this is the place, just be prepared for above average fare as well.

ProviderLocation: 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90024-3033 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90024-3033
ReviewText: Service was good, it was close to my hotel across the street. Food was marginal. I had the free range chicken and the waitress said it came in a neat pot, but it didn't. Served on a plate, not particularly appealing in presentation and very bland. Ice tea came in a high ball glass and cost $4. No offer of refills. Mojito came in the same size glass and cost $14. Atmosphere was outside near pool. I will never go back. If the food had been spectacular the price would have been irrelevant. But Bad and Expensive don't mix for me.

ProviderLocation: 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90024-3033 930 Hilgard Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90024-3033

ReviewTitle: The Real Deal for Mexican Food!

ProviderLocation: 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90015 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90015
ReviewText: This is one of the many available eateries at L. A. Live and like its fellows there is part of a national franchise. It does not aim at being anything more than this and succeeds within these limits. Los Angeles, however, has so many more interesting and valuable places to eat excellent meals that's it a shame so many visitors to the city only experience touristy places like this. (As an example, the flautas which are supposed to be crispy fried rolled tacos are served with a watery sauce on top that completely defeats the purpose...no crisp left by the time they arrive at the table!) That having been said, if all you want is a run-of-the-mill "Mexican" dish accompanied by alcoholic beverages, this is your place.

ProviderLocation: 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90015 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90015
ReviewText: This restaurant was close to my hotel so I gave it a try. I had the cauliflower vegetarian tacos, which were ok. ReviewText: Went here for a quick dinner and beer, got sat up the bar which is fine. Ordered the vegetarian nachos with spicy guacamole. Was pretty tasty, my salsa came with a hair. Told the bar guy he literally took the hair out and gave it back. Great.

ProviderLocation: 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90015 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90015
ReviewText: I had lunch today on their outside patio. It's all shady and comfortable. I enjoyed their mini carne tinga tacos which came with bowls of rice and beans. ProviderLocation: 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90015 800 West Olympic Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90015
ReviewText: Went to Rosa Mexicano for some drinks with a friend. Had some chips, salsa, and guacamole. All of it was delicious. I would go back for dinner.

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: Was looking for a new place for lunch and found this gem. Quickly on our fav list. Can't wait to come back for dinner. Chicken milanese cooked to perfection!

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: Parking: Didn't look difficult, but we walked the 15+ minutes from The Tangerine. The neighborhood is good, so there's no worries about walking. Ambiance: Beautiful wood floors, dark tables, very romantic. A little too dark to read the menus, but I'm getting older so there's that. Outdoor seating if you wish. They have a nice bar you can sit at and eat if you wish, but don't serve cocktails. Service: Mixed Results. On the plus side, our waiter steered us toward perfect wine pairings with our ceviche appetizer and hangar steak main course. However, we had a major hiccup in that our main dish came while we were still finishing our appetizer. On the tiny table it was very awkward space-wise, not to mention not yet being ready for the main course. Food: Amazing. The Corvina Ceviche was perfect. The fish was light and tender and not over powered by the leche de tigre, with thinly sliced onion, and crunchy corn. The tartness was well balanced and went well with the sauvignon blanc wine. If you love beef, be sure to get some here. The hangar steak was perfectly medium rare to order with a beautiful char on the outside, served with 3 sauces: garlic confit, chimichurri and a pickled pepper / onion. We also ordered the green pepper corn cream sauce for an additional $3 - well worth it. I could have eaten that alone as a soup (just kidding - but it was delicious and paired perfectly with the meat). We had a side of creamed spinach, which was a cheesy cream sauce disguised as a vegetable. That is not a complaint! Dessert was fine - I had the crepes but wouldn't order them again. Nothing wrong with them, just overly sweet. My husband had the bread pudding and couldn't stop raving about it. Overall, an excellent experience. If we are back in the area, we will definitely be back, but we wouldn't order our whole meal at once to ensure it's not rushed.

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: We've been several times, and the food and service is always very good. Servers knowledge of the wine is always spot on.

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: Friday night we went to Malbec and what a wonderful meal we had. We started with the carpaccio which we loved. Raw thinly sliced beef topped with arugula, Parmesan & some olive oil. Very flavorful. My husband got the bacon wrapped filet and I had the flat iron steak with chimichurri sauce. Both were excellent and I would highly recommend either of them. I also got the mushroom, carmelized onion & Gorgonzola sauce on the side-delicious!! Our waitress Amber was spot on and gave us great service, good recommendations and was friendly. Dessert crepe was amazing! Can't wait to go back!

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: This is probably the best Argentinian food in the Southland. Located in toluca lake on riverside dr, 4 blocks east of cahuenga. Incredible rib-eye and lamb chops. Good service.
ReviewTitle: Best Argentinian food in Los Angeles area!

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: I just had one of the best dinning experience in my life. If you want to be taken away for the noise of the city and carried to the Pappas grass of Argentina with beautiful music and relaxed envorment this is the place .the food was outstanding even though I just had a salad and dessert .

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: Malbec was recommended by a work colleague. It is a cozy, although very dark, neighbourhood bistro situation in Toluca Lake. As I was a walk-in and solo diner, I opted to sit at the bar. The restaurant filled to capacity on a Tuesday evening, which is always a good sign. I had the skirt steak with the chimichurri sauce and grilled vegetables, which was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Watching the salads come out of the kitchen, they looked very good and definitely meal size if accompanied with a chicken breast or could easily split between two people for an appetizer. The service was friendly, menu prices moderate and food very tasty.

ProviderLocation: 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles , CA 91602 10151 Riverside Drive , Los Angeles, CA 91602
ReviewText: Love this spot! The ambiance is lovely - dark and romantic - with a fantastic wine list. I've been impressed with the food I've had as well. I haven't tried too many of the heavy meat dishes here. I don't usually eat meat and I understand that they are "known" for their steaks but I have to say the sole that I had was really tasty and the sides were great. They also have this great appetizer platter that's basically an antipasto of sorts and it was big enough for a light meal for two! Great flavors with great wine to compliment. I would absolutely recommend. I do wish the outside looked a little tidier. I think the plastic awning is a bit of a turn-off for a lot of folks. It was for me for many years! But, hey, I gave it a shot and I hope you do too!

ProviderLocation: 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90069-4707 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90069-4707
ReviewText: Before I go into detail about my personal experience, I would like to say that this is a fabulous restaurant that really focuses on the visual presentation of the meals. Waiting Area: We made our reservation for 7:15 and were seated within a 15 minute period as it was very crowded. The waiting area is right next to the entrance and their is only a small couch for about 5 people to sit so we were forced to stand. This was very awkward as the restaurant is actually very small and many waiters had to come thru the standing area to serve guest in the other room right across from the entrance. Service: Once we were seated, I had the unfortunate placement of being seated in the aisle where waiters were constantly walking behind me and often bumping into me. The server we had was great and her cheery personality made all the previous issues we experienced fade away. She was very attentive throughout our entire meal and bubbly personality made for an enjoyable time. Food: The food was surprisingly very good. I expected the meals to be decent and more so focused on presentation but this was not the case. The portions were reasonable and were very filling. I had the Lobster mac and cheese which came in a nice little mouse trap with real cheese attached to the end and my wife had the Salmon. We were both really satisfied with our meals. Presentation/Recommendation: The presentation of all the food items, as expected, was excellent. The restaurant truly is creative with their presentation and makes for a fun experience, especially if you have multiple people within your party. I would definitely recommend all to try out this restaurant without hesitation. This recommendation is not just for the presentation, which is a great feature, but simply for the wonderful food as well.

ProviderLocation: 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90069-4707 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90069-4707
ReviewText: We went to Barton G for my wife's birthday, and we did have a reservation for 8:45pm and arrived a little bit earlier about 8:30 or 8:40pm, but was seated right away, so we both like how they actually made the people with a reservation a priority. Not too much to say about this place, but the customer service was great. The food was ok also, we ordered the lobster mac and cheese, the bucket of bones, and the Marie Antoinette head for dessert, but we didn't go there expecting a 5-star meal, you are really just paying for the presentation of the food, which we already knew. Only thing I recommend is if you are going as a couple to maybe share two different appetizers. This is a restaurant you must do at least once.

ProviderLocation: 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90069-4707 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90069-4707

ProviderLocation: 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90069-4707 861 N La Cienega Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90069-4707
ReviewText: I had tried the one in Miami and found it wonerful, but the LA one has a different vibe that is great as well.
