ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: The place was packed on Saturday night 5:45 for dinner. Even with the full room, our service was excellent. The choices for fish were superb and our dinner was well prepared. Validated parking and easy access to drive back the the Music Center in short order.

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: Four of us had dinner before a hockey game. It was an easy walk from the restaurant to the Staples Center. All of enjoyed our meals and the wait staff was attentive and professional.

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: The food was excellent and the service great. They allow you to valet park at no charge for lunch and until the play is over. (I honestly don't know what their policy is for dinner.) We attend the South Coast Repetory Theatre often and we will definitely return to the restaurant.

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: My favorite person and I have frequented Water Grill often and have NEVER been disappointed! Whether its for a first date, romantic evening, business meeting or just hanging out with friends - if you enjoy excellent seafood, great atmosphere and incredible service, this is the place to go!

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: My husband and I have eaten here a few times and love it! I loved the Black Cod Miso and he had a whole fish that you made into taco's it was amazing. The service is also great, very helpful and friendly. We also took our grown children here and they liked it too.

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: The Water Grill Restaurant is one of my favorite restaurants...fantastic seafood(big variety), what can I say about the wine...Nectar and by the way Water Grill Restaurant serves Rombauer Chardonnay by the glass, while many restaurants do not. The service is perfect and fast as always! The whole family was satisfied while the prices were quite reasonable. It is a must especially for seafood lovers!!!

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: What a lovely restaurant. A glass of wine and an oyster sampler platter was perfect. Pricy but perfect. Not many restaurants serve Rombauer Chardonnay by the glass but they do! Loved sitting at the bar for my indulgence And break from a hectic day.

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: I was looking forward to eating here ever since I knew I was going to be traveling to LA and staying downtown. As it turned out, this was my last dinner before taking the red eye home. I liked the vibe of the place as I entered. My reservation was in order and I was asked is I wanted a hightop along the Windows or a "regular" table. I opted for regular. My server had a couple of other tables to manage--on was a party of 11. He did that well while giving me plenty of attention. I started with the grilled octopus. It was different than any I had be served before but it proved to be quite good. I had my mind set on ordering a grilled whole fish but when I saw the Dover sole on the menu all plans went out the door. It was delicious. Too full for dessert but my server suggested I save room the next time for their bread pudding. There will be a next time and I will.

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: I used to work downtown LA and the Water Grill was a staple. I went back recently for dinner and still at the very top! Ambiance --- comfy, elegant, just the right lighting. Food -- fresh, fresh seafood...oysters, clams, lobster, crab, you name it. And best cocktails. The grande dame downtown is still alive and well. On a Friday night it was packed and had lots of great energy.
ReviewTitle: Still One of my Favorite Restaurants in Los Angeles!

ProviderLocation: 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90071-2602 544 S Grand Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90071-2602
ReviewText: I went there after I read some of the reviews on trip advisor and I stayed in a downtown hotel (Sheraton) which is in 10 min walking distance. Even on a Friday evening and as single guest the waiter was very attentive and treated me very kind. I had the miso soup which was just delicious and the grilled sea bass was one of the best I ever had, form on the outside, soft and mouthwatering on the inside. The dessert, a mango sorbet was a little symphony in a sliver bowl. I wish I would have a pace like this in my neighborhood.

ProviderLocation: 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles , CA 91367 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles, CA 91367
ReviewText: We enjoy coming here for happy hour as dinner. The bar is relatively small, so is may be full at high-demand times, but we have rarely had any trouble getting seated. There is always a nice selection of drinks and appetizers. Sharing two or three appetizers fills us up, and it's less expensive than having a regular dinner. The service is always friendly.

ProviderLocation: 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles , CA 91367 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles, CA 91367
ReviewText: i usually go to Roy's for special occasions (4-5 times per year) with my wife and have usually enjoyed it but i made the mistake of going on Valentines Day and was very disappointed. Despite reservations they provide an undesirable table location and refused to change it. My lobster was cold and missing a claw, my filet was also cold and when they recooked it it was overdone. They hunted for my missing claw and couldn't find it so they brought me a piece of scrap from the tail. it seems that the more i go to Roy's the less appealing it is and the food and service is deteriorating. The service by the wait staff is always first class and maybe the difference was because of the holiday. a final comment , i really dislike it when i order a drink such as a Manhattan or martini and it comes 2/3 full either because the wait staff spilled some of the bar short poured, neither of which is acceptable but no one accepts responsibility this is not the sign of a first class restaurant.

ProviderLocation: 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles , CA 91367 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles, CA 91367
ReviewText: We enjoy having dinner here on special occasions. If you're in the mood for a lot of foodl, the prix fixe dinners are a good deal.. What we are more likely to do is arrive during happy hour, sit in the bar, and share a couple of appetizers. That is plenty of food for us. This time we had the crispy chicken spring rolls and the lobster potstickers, and we each had a glass of wine. We were in the mood for a little dessert, so we shared something we hadn't tried before, a coconut panna cotta. All in all a great meal.

ProviderLocation: 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles , CA 91367 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles, CA 91367
ReviewText: For a chain restaurant, Roy's always gives the impression that it is a one outlet, stand alone, innovative fusion, cuisine restaurant. This was our first visit in about 2 years since before the Topanga Village opened across the street, and it did not disappoint. The menu is as simple as it is innovative. The service was attentive and friendly. New is a seasonal, 3 course prix fixed menu. We ordered the Osso Buco from that menu and the Chicken with Szechuan Shrimp from the main menu. Both were delicious, but the sauce with the chicken and shrimp made you want to like the porcelain off the plate! Be sure to order the signature pineapple upside down cake. It is extraordinary and definitely not your Aunt Alice's Pineapple Upside Down Cake. The restaurant does offer a counter where you can eat and watch the chefs cook.

ProviderLocation: 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles , CA 91367 6363 Topanga Canyon Rd. , Los Angeles, CA 91367
ReviewText: After having a wonderful experience at Roy's restaurant in Honolulu, Hawaii, we wanted to re-live that experience closer to home. Unfortunately, we were disappointed in more ways than one. I'd like to start with the positives of our experience. We started our evening by having drinks in the bar. The bartender was attentive and the drinks were fantastic! Loved Roy's Mai Tai and our friends enjoyed the Mango Mojito. Jeannie L , our server for the evening, was delightful. Unfortunately, the rest of our experience that evening was less than satisfying. It's to be expected that dining at a popular restaurant on a Saturday evening will have some glitches, but boy they must have all been at our table! Once we were seated and drink order taken, the bussers for our table were very inconsiderate -- especially how they placed items on the table. Not only did they throw their arms in front of our faces while we were in the middle of a conversation to place items on the table, but they were like bulls in a China shop when refilling glasses with water, taking plates away, etc. It was if they were in such a hurry to get it done, they did not care how it affected our dining experience. Additionally, they removed or attempted to remove plates of our guests before they were finished with their meal. Maybe that's one of my pet peeves, but when a guest is trying to enjoy their meal, even if someone at the table may have finished eating, don't make the other guest still eating feel like that have to rush to finish because the bussers want to clear the table. I'm not there to win a race, I'm there to enjoy my food and evening with friends. At least ask the person if they are done without touching the person's plate. The guest shouldn't have to tell them to stop, they are not done with their meal. At a high-end restaurant like Roy's, one would think management would want their customers to enjoy their experience in a relaxed setting, not made to feel rushed and having to dodge arms of their bussers for fear of being elbowed by those bussers. Now on to the food. Many of the dishes we ordered were as expected. The appetizers were very good, especially the canoe boat and the tuna. Unfortunately, same cannot be said for the main courses. Roy's is known for their fish, but the fish we had was disappointing. The portions of fish were small (the Mahi Mahi was maybe 4 ounces) and just average in preparation and taste, and the butterfish was mushy in texture. Not a dish I would recommend on the menu. Unfortunately, because of our experience at Roy's in Woodland Hills, we will not be returning. .
ReviewTitle: Disappointed and Glitches Galore -- In More Ways Than One

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: Ok, maybe Tex-Mex has ruined me but although this was a cute place, the food was bland and seemed over cooked. The waitress wasn't very personable; however, the fellow who bused the table was charming! Standouts were chips and the fresh flour tortillas. Everything else just blended in together-no real distinct tastes. If the salsa had been spicy, that would have helped! Parking is an issue as other reviewers have mentioned.
ReviewTitle: Fun hole in the wall; food-meh!

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: Great place and great, authentic food! A bit trendy due to its location, peak hours will find you looking for parking and waiting for a table. If you have some extra time to plan, you can get effectively the same food at the Westchester location which has a much larger dining room and a bar too.
ReviewTitle: Excellent food, and if it's too busy just drive on down to Westchester!

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: I was in Los Angeles in June 2014. I eat at both Paco's Tacos restaurants. My favorite food there has to be the warm tortillas and salsa. I could not stop my self from eating the entire bowl. The hard shell beef and chicken tacos are great. They use real chicken and real shredded beef. Real authentic Mexican food.

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: Started going here 30 years ago. It is exactly the same inside as it was 30 years ago- don't mess with a great thing. The food in my opinion is great and just what I want from a LA Mexican restaurant. The locals eat here and love it. Parking is quite rare- just look around the neighborhood for a spot. Prices are reasonable and they even have their own fresh tortilla maker - heavenly.
ReviewTitle: Still great 30 years and counting for me

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: We live in Midwest, but have family in LA and have been coming here for years. My grown kids satisfy their urge for classic Mexican Food by coming here when we visit. Their burritos, which I get wet with red enchilada sauce is massive and priced very reasonable. The namesake tacos are always excellent, along with beans and rice. Can get black beans or refried beans. The dining decor is simple, with the fish tank as the center of attention. The main attraction is watching the ladies make by hand tortillas all thru the evening. One of my wife's favorites all time foods. The bring them in a basket right out of the fry pan. She loves them warm with some butter. You gotta try it. Enjoy!

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: Paco's Tacos on Centinela Ave always has a line out front and for good reason. Yesterday I was craving huevos rancheros for breakfast and found myself near Pacos. It can be difficult to park but worth going around the corner a few times. The food is great, there is a woman making homemade tortillas, fish tanks with tropical fish, crazy decorations, you feel like you are in a very authentic Mexican Restaurant. Waiters buzz around, service is great. I have also ordered their seafood tostada which is like a stew- also excellent.

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: This place i believe is the oriignal Paco's there is another on Manchester in Los Angeles. I think i like the one on Manchester better. Its a bigger place more people more noise but i feel like the food is better and the service is better.

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: This is actually the third branch of the original shop on Centinela in West LA (the second, on Lincoln, closed after a fire years ago). Notable for its handmade tortillas, Paco's just serves up classic, good tasting, north-of-the-border Mexican food. It's staffed with friendly people and has a bright atmosphere (plenty of natural light; substantially remodeled from a former Red Onion restaurant years and years ago). The menu includes the typical tacos, burritos, enchiladas, tamales, chile rellenos, along with meat and seafood dishes. This place is popular. Despite having ample parking off of Truxton, finding an open parking space can be a challenge at times. This is another one of my regular spots.

ProviderLocation: 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90066-4908 4141 S Centinela Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90066-4908
ReviewText: Excellent hand-made tortillas in-house, huge portions and great service. An LA tradition and should be a stop on anyone's tour of LA. Highly recommend. Tough parking during lunch rush, so be prepared to search a bit for a place to park your car.

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: Very Romantic place. Our waiter was French and I can't remember his name but he was so nice and attentive !! Wine wonderful selection and the food was wonderful!! Highly recommend this staple near Beverly Hills. It's been here a long time for a reason.

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: We leave near by so it is ok, expensive but and if you do not mind pay more for the star that maybe will pop in for a bite, well that is the place to go. We had pasta, ok, wine ok, won't go back as we have better choices around the area.

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: Was recommended this restaurant from the hotel. The restaurant is like being in small place of Venice Italy. The entrees and the starters were to die for. Would highly recommend the seafood pasta. Visited twice this week and will be back again.

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: Recommended by the hotel we were staying in, we enjoyed a fantastic dinner here. Food was authentic Italian, presented beautifully and tasted great. We enjoyed the mushroom tortellini with truffles (incredible) and ahi appetizers, followed by the wild boar bolognese and branzino. Really wonderful food. Service was another highlight - attentive, humorous and engaging. We felt very welcome even though the restaurant was very quiet on a mid week night. Would absolutely return here when we next visit LA!

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: The facility is unprepossessing, the décor is classic, the menu is Italian in Italian, the service is spectacular, the food is divine. Highly recommended.

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: Very small restaurant across from the massive Cedars-Sinai Medical Center on 3rd Street. It doesn't look too impressive from the street, but I took a chance when I saw some doctors eating there. The Ravioli d'Aragosta (lobster ravioli) was a work of art. It was almost a shame to eat it... but it was so good. The bread with the spinach dip is also very nice. Good service and they are nice to you. It is a bit on the high price side, but doctors can afford it, I guess.
ReviewTitle: This is the place the doctors from Cedars-Sinai eat

ProviderLocation: 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-3323 8638 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-3323
ReviewText: I am sometimes stuck for the better part of a day at La Cienega/San Vicente/Third Street on business. Most of the sit down restaurants are now gone, and fast food joints are full of people chowing down in haste. Locanda Veneta is an excellent reprieve from the hustle and bustle of this neighborhood with the big mall and Cedars Sinai hospital. They have 3 excellent lunch specials which are served promptly. For about $15 you can get excellent soup and a ginormous gourmet salad of your choice. For $21, a starter and the hot entree of your choice. This last week I had the filet of sole in a fantastic lemon sauce, a real sauce not just juice. It came with carrots, green beans and 4 roasted potato pieces. For $27 you can get things like pasta with ragu of wild boar, really yummy. Service is efficient and high end - like they come scoop up the bread crumbs. The restaurant is quiet enough to hold business meetings here. I once had a 3 hour mid afternoon meeting in a corner table following lunch. There is a small parking lot next to the restaurant which is the best buy for all day parking in this area, easily $10 cheaper than the Cedars/medical building lots. Not quite sure how it works if you park just for lunch. There is street parking if the goddess of parking is smiling on you that day. There are outside tables but I never find eating right next to heavy traffic to be appealing. There are 3 or 4 steps to enter the restaurant. If that is an issue, call them, there might be a back entrance for wheelchairs. Of course you can eat outside at ground level.
ReviewTitle: A quiet, affordable epicurean oasis in a hugely busy neighborhood

ProviderLocation: 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-4309 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-4309
ReviewText: The place is outstanding! If you are looking for a place that truly takes you away, this is your Restaurant. This is the best full Mediterranean experience in LA. I was born in The Med and it truly made me feel back home for a moment. I actually took my wife for dinner. We order a cheese plater and the Lamb and Duck. It was really tasty! Loved the Confi sauce! Service is also good and desserts (although a bit expensive) are amazing. Try the coconut + mango cheese cake. My recommendation. Go for a romantic dinner. Take your time relax and once you pass the door, Forget about tour curent Life and tell yourself your are on Holidays because you will feel that way ;) This really feels like a Mediterranean Dream!
ReviewTitle: Travel to The Mediterranean without taking a plane! A truly Mediterranean dream

ProviderLocation: 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-4309 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-4309
ReviewText: Excellent menu with varied choices, all our meals were outstanding. Service was friendly and appropriate, with welcome suggestions. Ambiance was eclectic, with trees and other unusual touches. We've enjoyed every visit here.

ProviderLocation: 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-4309 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-4309
ReviewText: We decided to celebrate my birthday here, was posted as French cuisine, unfortunately it's Moroccan dishes, server was nice & friendly, indeed it's a very romantic place to dine. Good Wine selections and they also offered 3 course set menus with suggested wine pairing. We will definitely come back

ProviderLocation: 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-4309 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-4309
ReviewText: For those couples looking for a romantic intimate evening,, accompanied by wonderful food, then I recommend dining at the Little Door. I had the lamb chops and my wife ordered the duo of duck and both dishes were amazing . Look forward to going back
ReviewTitle: Amazing ambiance and food. A wonderful romantic evening

ProviderLocation: 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles , CA 90048-4309 8164 W 3rd St , Los Angeles, CA 90048-4309
ReviewText: We heard alot about this place and good reviews. We took the duck dish and it was really good. It reminded us of Swedish pytt I panna,but we duck and egg on the top.

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: The food was excellent and lots for the money, I could have ate there 10 times more! Great place to eat and not spend 3 hours waisting sight seeing time.

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: Ok the food was ok but after pushy service from Chris re the bill and his TIP which was suggested on the bill left us totally flat and real bad taste in the mouth. He gave us the option to keep the cheque open or settle. We opted to keep open but he then said he was finishing so cos of his tip he would bring us bill. Who wants to be forced into putting a tip down. Aware of how it works don't need a jumped up waiter telling us what to tip!!!!!

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: Service was quick, espresso excellent, and my eggs benedict was superb. My only complaint was they they had 3 ceiling fans running at full blast when it was an overcast day and the temperature had fallen considerably.

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: Danny's is a very busy pub on the corner of a very busy intersection. We sat in one of the two outdoor tables and people watched. The service was excellent, the food was too. We also had the beet salad. Lots of beer choices, 805 Blonde was my fav.
ReviewTitle: Best Grilled Salmon Club I have ever had!

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: We wandered along the Venice Beach walkway searching for a place for lunch and picked Danny's Venice Deli because is is a bit off 'the strip' and thus thought it might be a little less touristy than several other nearby restaurants. We were seated immediately at an outside table giving us a chance to 'watch the parade' of locals and tourists without being annoyed by too much loud music, etc. We had a simple lunch (burgers and chii) and I must say that the burger was one of the best burgers I have had in a while. It was large, flavorful and delicious. My husband's chili over corn chips was different, delicious and fun. Prices are quite reasonable, considering the quality of the food and service. Recommended.
ReviewTitle: Very good, slighty less touristy restuarant in Venice Beach.

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: I was staying in the hostel above, and i ate there twice. The first time for conveiance and the 2nd time because the food was so damn good! The staff was SUPER friendly! It's a little pricey but for some yummy food that was right downstairs I couldn't complain!

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: Given the central Venice location, I thought this would be a tourist trap but the room looked large and comfortable and the menu excellent. I ordered french toast with sausage and bacon and it was plentiful and tasted wonderful. Service was quick and fine without being especially warm or welcoming.
ReviewTitle: Really excellent food and good service

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: The food was good. Big portions. Tasty. Had the ribs. Enjoyed them. The place is decorated nicely. the Bathroom could be cleaner but the restaurant and bars are nice. A very large menu. Good selection of various foods.

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: When we visited Danny's it was a very busy Friday night. They were short staffed but admitted that before we ordered which was very honest and we appreciated that. Bar staff were a little unfriendly but the table waiting staff were great. Friendly and fun. It was happy hour when we went so drinks were reasonable and appetisers were half price. Half of our party are vegetarian and their was great choice. I had the falafel burger which was yummy. My husband had the brisket and mash which he really really enjoyed. This is a great historical restaurant and defiantly worth a visit for food.
ReviewTitle: Great food and mostly great staff

ProviderLocation: 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles , CA 90291-4102 23 Windward Ave , Venice , Los Angeles, CA 90291-4102
ReviewText: Lemonade and Sandwich were both great. I had the chance to sit in the mini - terrace on the entrance so that I could enjoy Venice life. Nice personnel
ReviewTitle: Great pastrami sandwich and views to the beach

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: A lively bar for pre-dinner drinks. Excellent service with knowledgeable servers. We happened to be there on a weekend when it was Dine LA, so it was a special menu. I had the lobster and lobster which was delicious. The lobster tail was cooked perfectly as were the slipper lobster. One terrific aspect of this restaurant is that there is only a $2 corkage charge, so feel free to bring your own bottle! The creme brulee was creamy and rich. Can't wait to go back.

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: This place has been here for years and is a local fav. it is west coast French based food. the prices are extremely reasonable and the food is much better than the prices reflect. the wine list is priced the same way...good selection with little markup. good service...everything is good here, always.

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: Cafe Bizou serves great food, large portions and provides good service. Bring your own wine as corkage is only $2 per bottle.
ReviewTitle: Great food at a reasonable price

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: This is one of our regular "go-to" restaurants when we want to be assured of a really good dinner and don't want to invest the equivalent of a house down payment. We love that they only charge $2 corkage (that's no typo it's TWO DOLLARS) and have occasional $29 prix fixe three-course dinners. I often wonder how they can do it and still serve excellent food in a delightful setting. Getting in isn't easy so be sure to plan well in advance. There's valet parking right in front and an awning with a sign that you can't miss. Be sure to get the lobster bisque or escargot appetizer (a $3 up charge but well worth it - their sauce is perfect) and don't be afraid to order anything on the menu; we've tried pretty much everything they serve and it's all excellent.
ReviewTitle: Great food and value - I don't know how they do it

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: Eaten here many times, and the combination of food price and quality is second to none in the LA area. Make a reservation as the secret is out, you will not be disappointed. The steak au pauve is my favorite.
ReviewTitle: Great value, fun place , best corkage in LA

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: First of all and this is important to me, they have a very small corkage fee, I believe it's $2.00. They have prix frixe lunches which include an appetizer and a main course. There is quite a large selection on the menu so something for everyone. The service was outstanding at lunch. They weren't that crowded but we had a very early lunch, I hear at dinner a reservation is a must and they are jammed. Great service and great food. 2 of us had the salmon, one had Escargot. For appetizer my friend had the mushrooms and loved them I had the salad with figs and goat cheese. Delicious. We passed on dessert! I hadn't been there for many years because it's not that close to me but I was meeting 2 friends nearby and this was convenient for all of us. I will go out of my way go to back ASAP

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: One of my favorite restaurants in Los Angeles. Top quality ingredients, excellent recipes and preparation, amazing sauces, desserts are fantastic. Their entrecote steaks are really superb. i have made it about half way through the menu over the last 10 years of going here and not one dish was unpleasing. Decent wine list, great house wines. and excellent coffee / espresso. The service is excellent. Overall reasonably priced considering the great quality. i try to eat here at least once a week if my schedule allows it. Always a great dinning experience. The lunch specials are especially great. One last thing....they make the best TartTatin, French apple tart, just about anywhere outside France. Do not leave this restaurant without trying the Tart Tatin....trust me.

ProviderLocation: 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 91423-3512 14016 Ventura Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 91423-3512
ReviewText: Upscale setting for upscale brunch food. Service is very kind and attentive, but get there early enough on the weekends to avoid the larger crowds that tend to gather for loud celebrations.

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: As an out of town visitor, I was concerned that this would be a tourist spot since it is walking distance to the wax museums, souvenir shops and theater. But thankfully, this is a genuine and classy spot. Great ribeye. Solid service. Comfortable booths and old school atmosphere. A definite winner.

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: My wife & I ate at M&FG recently while in town due to it's high ratings on TripAdvisor and celebrity history. We loved the old throwback decor, bar and staff's attire. We were seated at a booth, ordered 2 glasses of wine, split a lettuce wedge w/ blue cheese and some bread. Off to a good & delicious start. For our main course we split the beef short rib ravioli, filet mignon and a side of the au gratin potatoes. The ravioli wasn't bad but not amazing. In all fairness our waiter tried to talk me out of it but I thought it sounded interesting. FYI - He recommended the spaghetti instead. The filet was amazing and the potatoes just good. When we left we were stuffed! In hindsight we should have skipped the potatoes and we would've still had plenty to eat. We would definitely eat here again the next time we're in town.

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: We are Southern Californians who have lived here our entire lives, yet never visited the famous Hollywood haunt of people "in the business" and local politicos. The interior furnishings and decor of Musso and Frank Grill have not been changed (or cleaned?) in decades. Some of the old style is cool retro, some of it is just old. Upon arrival, we left our car with the valet in the back lot, entered the back entrance through the kitchen and past old phone booths and wooden doors leading to restrooms which have not been updated in 40 years. We were seated in a red leather booth with high back wooden walls separating us from other diners, but also preventing us from people watching! Our waiter was dressed old school with starched white shirt, bow tie, red apron which evidently accompany the old school attitude. He provided little description or explanation nor did he recommend personal favorites. Our cocktail order took several minutes to be served even though the House was only 1/4 filled on a rainy noontime. An appetizer of the famous steak tartare with a quail egg was truly superb! However, the entrees of veal shank with vegetables and chicken Marsala were only average and not worth the $30 price. The bread pudding dessert was good. As we left our lunch table, we toured both dining rooms, examining the interesting photos, furniture, bar fixtures, and lighting. As a museum, Musso and Frank is worth a visit. As a dining destination, I'm not so sure. Maybe I'll stick with the famous flannel cakes, steak tartare, and a cocktail!

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: On the last night of our vacation we decided to have a nice dinner at Musso and Frank, which was recommended to us by a friend. The outside of the building is fairly nondescript, but once you step inside you experience the vintage atmosphere with the wood finishes, dim lighting, and red booths. We did not have a reservation, but we were immediately seated at a booth in the back. Our waiter was professional and attentive, but not overly friendly. The bus person was also attentive and promptly refilled waters and removed dishes. The menu is extensive and we had a hard time deciding what to order. First off, martinis were ordered. They were well prepared, cold, and the extra was delivered to the table in a bowl of ice so that it stayed cold. Nice touch. For our first course we ordered salads. The wedge salad was very large and the ingredients were fresh. For our entrees, we finally decided on the petite cut New York strip steak and lamb chops. Both were prepared exactly as ordered and were flavorful. Since the entrees are ordered a la carte, we also ordered sides of Brussel sprouts and asparagus. While the Brussel sprouts were prepared well, the asparagus was probably the least favorite dinner item as it was slightly undercooked. After all of that food, we didn't even make an attempt at dessert. While quite an expensive dinner, we felt it was worth the experience and the food overall was very good. We would definitely return on a future trip and would recommend this restaurant for special occasions.

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: Musso and Frank's is all about good service and retro atmosphere. Where Producers met their newest stars. Food was very good and the service was excellent as usual. Their Pumpkin Ravioli was outstanding.

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: A must visit to soak up the old Hollywood atmosphere (and, most importantly, escape Hollywood Blvd). Great service and delicious comfort food (spaghetti & meatballs). For dessert, try the NY Cheesecake. It's way better than any I've had in NY! Tip: You'll be understandably tempted to load up on the delicious bread (and salty butter) your server will bring when you sit down. Don't. The portions are hearty.
ReviewTitle: Old Hollywood is alive in here

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: Very cool old school restaurant with a fantastic history and ties to old Hollywood. Appraently, it was a favorite of icons such as Charlie Chaplain and Orson Welles. Also, Warren Beatty sometimes visits. I loved that all the waiters were older men with red dinner jackets. I recommend the lobster and short rib ravioli, along with the bread pudding when dining here.
ReviewTitle: Great Old School Hollywood Dining Spot

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: Had a relatively late booking @ 2200 but was disappointed to find that the grill bar had closed, which would have been perfect for one person to pull up a chair and watch what was going on. Apart from that the service was attentive and the food very good - Steak was excellent.
ReviewTitle: Step back in time ... For great steaks!

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: Excellent service and atmosphere, getting to take in a piece of old Hollywood history. Food is good but not outstanding, or at least that's true of the lunch I ordered. But the staff really make you feel welcome.

ProviderLocation: 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles , CA 90028-6292 6667 Hollywood Blvd , Los Angeles, CA 90028-6292
ReviewText: Great old school steak house. Lots of history. Very unique items on the menu. If come back for sure.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Stayed prior to our cruise and it is a very nice hotel. Would of given a five if their bar and restaurant was open as stated. Breakfast was good, rooms were clean and decor was beautiful in lobby. They provided shuttle to ship which took less than five minutes.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Only choice without paying huge price. Fair in amenities. Room in separate building with hill and steps. Difficult if not ambulatory. No assistance offered. Shower didnt drain properly. Breakfast average.
ReviewTitle: Only cruise hotel close to port

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Conveniently located for cruising and taxi fare is less than $7.00 to port. Clean, friendly, and comfortable. The only disappointments were that the post cruise pick up begins at 9:00 am and we were disembarked at 8:00 am. Heard the parking rates were increasing to $10.00 per day. Overall excellent choice for us.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: the rooms and location of this hotel are ideal for the port of los angeles ,however the breakfast that was served in the morning was far from the standard i would expect from a large chain of hotels . The hot food had obviously been standing around for many hours and we ended up with just a bowl of cereal . I would rather have paid for a breakfast if this was all they could provide

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Well appointed room, rain shower in bathroom good complimentary breakfast. If you stay here make sure your room is not on the street side of hotel. Very busy street all night long could hear traffic, sirens and drag racing.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Flew in a day early for my Mexican Riviera cruise aboard the Norwegian Jewel. The Lyft ride from LAX was only $38 and it was a smooth ride. I arrived really early and checked in with the super friendly staff. They stored my luggage while I had to wait a couple of hours for a room; which wasn't bad it was still an early check in. If you want the free shuttle to the port make sure you sign up as soon as you check in. My room was huge. There's a coffee maker, iron, microwave and fridge. The tiny gym has a water dispenser. I did not check out the pool. Nearby there's a lot of fast food, Hawaiian BBQ, El Pollo Loco, a big CVS. I recommend the El Salvadorien restaurant on the same side of the street of the hotel for pupusas and delicious bean dip. Breakfast the next day was ok. I had fruit and some eggs but they had waffles and toast, good juice. You can arrange for a stay, park and cruise if you don't want to park at the World Cruise port. Overall I would recommend this property for a pre/post cruise stay with the friendly service, reasonably priced rooms (huge and looks newly renovated) and free cruise shuttle.
ReviewTitle: Convenient Pre Cruise Stay for NCL

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Always enjoy my stay at this hotel and very handy to public transport. Room way clean and everything worked as required. Have always used this hotel when required and will always do so when next in San Pedro wishing to catch a cruise ship.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: When I asked for a reservation, the manager at the front desk did everything she could to get me a nice room with a view. When I arrived, I needed some help with my bags and there was someone there within 5 minutes to assist me. My room was clean and comfortable. San Pedro has many nice places to eat and sights to see. I really enjoyed my stay.
ReviewTitle: I am so glad I didn't use something like Priceline.com.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: Unfortunately I suffered a case of bed bug bites (49 total all over my body) after staying in Room 101 roughly 3 weeks ago. The hotel was very apologetic about the situation and refunded my stay, but it was a very traumatic experience. I appreciate the manager's sympathetic response, but nonetheless I feel it's necessary to warn others of what I went through. It's unfortunate because everything else about my stay was positive. The gentleman at the front desk at checkin was courteous and personable. The breakfast was good. But unfortunately I cannot recommend the hotel based on my experience.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Pedro Hotel & Suites
ProviderLocation: 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles , CA 90731 111 South Gaffey Street , San Pedro , Los Angeles, CA 90731
ReviewText: So far my stay here has been amazing the staff is wonderful always helpful and ready to assist you with any difficulties you're having. As for the food it's to die for! The breakfast is 5 stars in my eyes. I have stuffed myself almost every morning I went downstairs & they have a gym if you tend to burn some calories after that wonderful meal. Thanks again Staff of Best western you guys are wonderful. Maids 5/5 Front desk 5/5 Management 5/5 Security 5/5 Your Friend Peter J Malandrinos

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: Had high expectations for the "Michelin-starred" restaurant after reading great reviews. Unfortunately the food did not meet my expectations when I compare to a Michelin star restaurant in Italy, France or Scandinavia or even an average restaurant in Italy. Food lacked of elegance. I was really impressed by the wine list though, a lot Italian wines to choose from (expensive). In total, ok dinner, wine and service, but nothing spectacular and to pricey for what you get.

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: We had a great experience at Osteria Mozza. After some initial hiccups with our reservation we were assigned a table in the bar (which was a quite good seat after all). The ambiance of the place is great, the food was superb and quality price was Wine list is very good. All in all one of the best Italian restaurants that I've visited in the past couple of years.

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: Corner seats at the bar gave us a great view of the house, the sous chefs working behind the bar, and each other. Food was delicious, and service was very friendly. Wine list was ridiculously long (in a good way), with an unbelievable spanse of Italian reds; but the (somewhat cold) sommelier helped us select one that was just right. All in all, a wonderful experience I wish I lived close enough to, to repeat often. Tables could be somewhat dark, and noise level was a bit high.

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: I'm a NY Italian and I've traveled in Italy as teenager. The memories linger but the time is long. After my fora bite of the burrata, i got teary eyed as the flavour was so reminiscent of my Italy trip, it was as though I was that young teenager all over again. Then the stacked butter leaf lettuce salad with egg and hazelnuts came and I must say, I'm not a fan of salads I have to cut up myself but this one as so filled with ingredients that blended so well together and burst with a lightness flavours in my mouth that, for a moment, I bought there is no better food than salad. The crowd ranged from mature and affluent to young hipsters and the marble counter bar allows you to see the luscious fresh ingredients being put into several of the dishes. I'm hooked! Grazie Tanti

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: Me and my wife went to Osteria Mozza for my Birthday. My wife made the reservation through opentable and made sure she mentioned that it is my birthday. We arrived 10 minutes late which lead it to know that they only keep reservation for extra 15 minutes. We sat down and took sometime to go over all the menu. We ordered the grilled octopus as an appitizer, the corzetti stampati as our primo and the grilled orata (Seabream) as our secondi. We did not try their wine so i can not tell anything about that. We loved the Grilled octopus as it was grilled perfectly and was moist and delicious. The corzetti stampati was that good as I did not like the tomato sauce. The grilled orata was nothing special at all. The service was fine till we found out that they ignored the special remark we made on opentable that it is my birthday. The food was fine but the service was average, I would go back to try something else for sure and to enjoy the grilled octopus again.
ReviewTitle: Delicious Grilled Octopus and everything else average!!!!

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: Was in LA briefly and an old friend told me of this perfect little restaurant in Melrose. Sat at the bar and watched in amazement and awe of the care that they take in preparing everything. The staff was cleaning all of the greens and vegetables that go into the dishes by hand. By hand! Needless to say, everything ws sublime. One of the best meals I have had. And the atmosphere was great. The joint was busy but it was very cool. Surprised for such a happening place that it was't uptight. Very cool and relaxed vibe. Especially for LA!

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: This is my favorite kind of restaurant. The food is excellent. The ambiance is beautiful. The people are professional, nice and unpretentious. It is a very comfortable place to go if you are travelling solo or great for groups. Wine is pricey and very little parking available nearby so $12 for Valet. But it's LA. Enjoy!

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: I dined here on a recent Sunday evening. The place was fairly crowded, but you could get a seat at the bar with no problems. I understand that isn't always the case - especially on Fri and Sat nights. But the food is always creative and outstanding. The wine list is good as well, and the wine stewardess was very helpful and very pretty! The service is great as well. I don't eat red meat but still had several choices. And they are happy to prepare special orders if you have any food requests. I saw a pic of Chirstina Aguilera leaving this restaurant, but I didn't see anyone famous when I was there. I put the food here pretty close to my favorite, Osteria Angelini, which isn't far away on Beverly Blvd. But for overall dining experince, Mozza is just as good!!

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: This restaurant offered a truly unique spin on authentic Italian dishes. I had to use my phone to look up quite a few words on the menu, but the waitstaff was superb in being patient with me and explaining the dishes. The quality of the food was unbelievable. I would book another trip to Los Angeles just to eat at this restaurant. All aspects of the experience were excellent, from the accommodating staff, the quality of the food and the atmosphere. A small appetizer is passed out on your arrival, and I was treated to a complimentary digestivo, unlike anything I have ever tasted before. I was surprised by the cost as well...definitely reasonable for Los Angeles.
ReviewTitle: As if I were dining in Italy

ProviderLocation: 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles , CA 90038-3410 6602 Melrose Ave , Los Angeles, CA 90038-3410
ReviewText: I have been here twice. This last time I had a burrata that had just been flown in from Italy that day. It was delicious on this very good grilled, thick piece of bread. They have it on Fridays. That was 20$. They have numerous choices of mozzarella and burrata for appetizers. For my entree I had the ravioli with cheese and butternut squash. I must say it was the most ethereal light pasta I have ever had. I could have eaten 2 plates. I ordered a Margarita pizza from Pizza Mozza next store to go and it was excellent. Thin crust with excellent toppings. Basil, tomato, mozzarella. I also picked up a miscellaneous bag of Italian cookies from Pizza Mozza and they were excellent. I do agree with the other recent reviewer that the service did seem to wane. I had early reservations and at first had a lot of attention, but that dropped off and I waited quite a while until I could get the attention of my waitress again.

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: Only problem is there are a lot of different cheesecakes to try. They even have a Gluten Free one that is excellent. I love any with chocolate! Great place to take out or dine in. Large portions.

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: If you want a great place to eat in Beverly Hills then you have to try this place. Just like a normal restaurant but with the best cheesecake anywhere for sweet course. Open 24 hours a day you can eat at anytime serving all the usual fare in generous servings well presented. Staff and service top rate and great drinks. Would recommend to anyone but do be prepared to wait if you go in the evening.

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: While the lunches at the Cheesecake Factory are quite varied to the point where everyone should be able to find something that appeals, we like to go later in the afternoon for dessert. Cheesecake selections that will make it difficult to choose only one, but more than that. Try their strawberry shortcake and you will be hooked for life. Three sweet shortcakes, each with a scoop of ice cream in the middle, covered in fresh strawberries and delicious whipped cream. A heavenly treat if there ever was one.

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: On a tour of LA and needed food. I can always count on this restaurant for that. Even if it was just a bowl of soup and grilled cheese sandwich. Got to sit on the balcony and service was excellent even though they are always busy!

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: I have lost count how many times myself and my partner visited the Cheesecake Factory in the space of two weeks it must have been a weeks worth of Cheesecake and we even ate twice on our holiday there. The food is just as good as the cheesecakes and they have anything you could think of on the menus and the Cheesecake is just pure heaven!! I am still waiting for them to bring a Cheesecake Factory over to the UK to cure my cravings. I had the tacos for lunch one day which were so fresh and then I had the chicken sandwich for dinner another time which the portion size was incredible! The cheesecakes I've had the Oreo, reeses peanut butter, white chocolate caramel macadamia nut and more but they were my top three of the holiday. The mozzarella sticks and buffalo chicken wings are also a great combination for a starter but are also portion heavy so beware of food overload!

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: I went for Cheesecake! This place is so not like the one Penny works at in the Big Bang Theory, it is beautifully decorated, the staff were wonderful and the cheesecake to die for..

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: Wonderful food, excellent service, epic location. I had an amazing time, I've been there a few times and it was so worth it.

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: I love this place, the cheesecakes are so good!! The prices are ok, staff always friendly. I can't wait for my next visit :)

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: Came here for dinner whilst visiting The Grove. The place was full, but I was lucky to get a seat at the bar. The food was really tasty, and the service was friendly and fast. A great meal, and I would come back again.

ProviderLocation: 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles , CA 90036-6222 189 The Grove Dr , Los Angeles, CA 90036-6222
ReviewText: Look depending how much you like to spend for a meal Cheesecake Factory can be a bit pricey. That being said I have never been disappointed with the food,it has always delivered. If you have never gone then try it and for desert get what started it all... cheesecake!
